intro: Linosyris nigromontana, commonly known as the black mountain linosyris, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its dark purple to black flowers are notable for their striking coloration and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Linosyris nigromontana is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
